result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone B Mays was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION  REVIEW hearing in Br. 38 on 1/8/2016 at 1:15 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs, fees, surcharges, victim witness surcahrge, domestic violence surcharge and supervison fees as ordered.  Any amount remaining due and woing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA  sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with the victim or the mother of the victim, without the approval of the Court or agent.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 12 years old.
No firearms.

Anger management and continued programming.
Parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay supervision fees as determined by DOC
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone B Mays

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone B Mays in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Tyrone B Mays in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.   Court found that further review is needed.  Another review is set for 4-8-2016.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Bail Refund Check Packet
9/18/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements by Tami S. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 42 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 33 days served.  Court ordered 18 months Initial Term Of Confinement and 24 months Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

The Court stayed the sentence, and placed the defendant on 24 months probation.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 01/08/2016.
-Anger Management and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Parenting class.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-40 hours of community service at a non-profit, charitable organization.
-No contact with the victim or the mother of the victim without the approval of the Court or agent.
-No unsupervised contact with anyone under that age of 12 years old.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.

-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fee, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Victim Impact Statement, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms. Case adjourned to Branch 38.

As to Count 1 as amended:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Tyrone B Mays in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Physical Abuse of a Child (Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b) and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Tyrone B Mays not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant, upon the request of defense cousel.  There is ongoing investigation continuing on case, per the State.  Additional discovery was recently forwarded to defense counsel from the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-7-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court heard and granted Defense Motion to Modify Bail, with the consent of the State, and ordered a reduction in the cash bail from $5,000.00 to $2,000.00  mld
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Tyrone B Mays in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Tyrone B Mays in custody.  Molly Schmidt for Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bianca P., CD, AW (Ms. P.'s 3 year-old son), Tammy P. (Ms. P.'s mother).

Defendant Tyrone B Mays in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Tyrone B Mays in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
